item.title: Profunctors: An API, Part 3
item.description: /images/reflection-small.webp Photo by Jonatan Pie on Unsplash

item.title: Profunctors for the web developer: First intuitions, Part 2
item.description: /images/leaf-half-dead-small.webp Photo by Mario Dobelmann on Unsplash All of the paired transforms from Part 1 can be modeled with the interface that Profunctor provides but what does that mean and why is that useful? In Part 2 we will explore our first intuitions about these pairings: how they are similar to each other how they are different from each other how having a common interface for them improves the web developer's day at work

item.title: Profunctors for the web developer: Motivating examples, Part 1
item.description: Offering examples of profunctors that web developers might find motivating.
